channel.title: üè¢ University of Oxford on NeurIPS 2024
channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ University of Oxford on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: Can Learned Optimization Make Reinforcement Learning Less Difficult?
item.description: Learned optimizer OPEN tackles RL’s non-stationarity, plasticity loss, and exploration using meta-learning, significantly outperforming traditional and other learned optimizers.

item.title: Learning Segmentation from Point Trajectories
item.description: This paper introduces a novel unsupervised video object segmentation method using long-term point trajectories and optical flow, outperforming prior art by effectively combining sparse, long-term moti…

item.title: No-regret Learning in Harmonic Games: Extrapolation in the Face of Conflicting Interests
item.description: Extrapolated FTRL ensures Nash equilibrium convergence in harmonic games, defying standard no-regret learning limitations.

item.title: Pre-trained Text-to-Image Diffusion Models Are Versatile Representation Learners for Control
item.description: Pre-trained text-to-image diffusion models create highly effective, versatile representations for embodied AI control, surpassing previous methods.

item.title: Principled Bayesian Optimization in Collaboration with Human Experts
item.description: COBOL: a novel Bayesian Optimization algorithm leverages human expert advice via binary labels, achieving both fast convergence and robustness to noisy input, while guaranteeing minimal expert effort.
